name: 11.2 "The Beer Is Always Greener" Quiz | Television | 10 Questions

questions.text: Did Norm's tab get burned in the fire?
questions.explanation:
No.

	Sam had it in the safe. He said it was his most valuable asset, that maybe one day Norm would start paying and Sam could think about retiring. Norm told him to make other plans.

questions.text: What was the name of the telephone company man?
questions.explanation:
Bernard.

	Bernard was played by Glen Shadix. Shadix was born in 1952 in Alabama. In 2010 he died from a head injury after a fall. Before this he was having problems moving on his own and was confined to a wheel chair. As a teenager he underwent aversion therapy hoping to become a straight man.

questions.text: Why were Woody and Kelly fighting on their honeymoon?
questions.correct: They found out they were from two different sects of the Lutheran religion.
options: They couldn't agree on which hotel to stay at.
They found out that they'd each cheated on one another.
They were talking badly about each others' mothers.
questions.explanation:
They found out they were from two different sects of the Lutheran religion.

	She was Lutheran Church of America. He was Lutheran Church of Missouri Synod.

questions.text: Who was once a Boy Scout, but quit?
questions.explanation:
Norm.

	He said he learned as a Boy Scout to be prepared. Then he told Cliff he quit because there was talk about going on a hike.

questions.text: How many kinds of beers did the pub have, where Carla was temporarily working?
questions.explanation:
200.

	Norm told Cliff they should take a trip around the world before going back to Cheers. They asked Carla if she felt silly in her outfit, which Carla did.

questions.text: What kind of bonus did Carla get in her check?
questions.explanation:
Satisfied Customer.

	She said she'd never had a satisfied customer bonus before, in fact she'd never had a satisfied customer before.  Carla was much more friendly at the pub than she was at Cheers.

questions.text: What side of the egg did Kelly say got cracked: the narrow end or the rounded end?
questions.correct: rounded & rounded end & the rounded end
questions.explanation:
rounded & rounded end & the rounded end.

	Woody replied, "Kelly I don't even know who you are anymore". The talk about egg cracking came up while Lilith and Frasier were helping Woody and Kelly overcome their religious differences. Lilith was Jewish and Frasier was Episcopalian so they had knowledge on overcoming religious differences.

She was quitting Cheers.

	Sam couldn't believe after all the years with Carla that she'd just up and quit. Carla said he should be happy for her because she found a job that paid so well.

questions.text: Why did Carla quit the pub?
questions.correct: She was asked to train a woman who looked exactly like Diane Chambers.
options: She knew that she'd never be happy at the pub because Cheers was her home.
She missed Sam and wanted to be friends again.
She actually got fired for being mean.
questions.explanation:
She was asked to train a woman who looked exactly like Diane Chambers.

	Ellen was played by Julia Montgomery. In the episode, she did indeed look a lot like Shelley Long who played Diane Chambers in the early years of "Cheers".

questions.text: Did Carla tell Sam why she came back?
questions.explanation:
No.

	She made him promise never to go back to that bar and he agreed. She said a psycho killer would have been better.
